columns.name: creation_time
columns.description: The date and time the workgroup was created.

columns.name: additional_configuration
columns.description: Specifies a user defined JSON string that is passed to the notebook engine.

columns.name: bytes_scanned_cutoff_per_query
columns.description: The upper data usage limit (cutoff) for the amount of bytes a single query in a workgroup is allowed to scan.

columns.name: customer_content_kms_key
columns.description: Specifies the KMS key that is used to encrypt the user's data stores in Athena.

columns.name: enforce_workgroup_configuration
columns.description: If set to \"true\", the settings for the workgroup override client-side settings.

columns.name: effective_engine_version
columns.description: The engine version on which the query runs.

columns.name: selected_engine_version
columns.description: The engine version requested by the user.

columns.name: execution_role
columns.description: Role used in a notebook session for accessing the user's resources.

columns.name: publish_cloudwatch_metrics_enabled
columns.description: Indicates that the Amazon CloudWatch metrics are enabled for the workgroup.

columns.name: requester_pays_enabled
columns.description: If set to true, allows members assigned to a workgroup to reference Amazon S3 Requester Pays buckets in queries.

columns.name: s3_acl_option
columns.description: The Amazon S3 canned ACL that Athena should specify when storing query results.

columns.name: encryption_option
columns.description: Indicates whether Amazon S3 server-side encryption with Amazon S3-managed keys (SSE_S3), server-side encryption with KMS-managed keys (SSE_KMS), or client-side encryption with KMS-managed keys (CSE_KMS) is used.

columns.name: result_configuration_kms_key
columns.description: For SSE_KMS and CSE_KMS, this is the KMS key ARN or ID.

columns.name: expected_bucket_owner
columns.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID that you expect to be the owner of the Amazon S3 bucket specified by ResultConfiguration$OutputLocation.

columns.name: output_location
columns.description: The location in Amazon S3 where your query results are stored.
